tooltip.biggerreactors.buttons.reactor_a:
§bDeactivate Reactor
Residual heat will still generate
power/consume coolant.
tooltip.biggerreactors.buttons.waste_eje:
§bAuto-Eject Waste
Waste in the core will be ejected as soon as possible.

§bDon't Auto-Eject Waste
§dWaste must be manually ejected!

§bEject Waste Now
Ejects waste from the core.
1000 mB of waste equals 1 ingot.
§8Shift to dump any excess waste.
tooltip.biggerreactors.symbols.case_heat:
§bCase Heat
Heat of the reactor's fuel.
High heat raises fuel usage.
Core heat is transferred to the casing.
Transfer rate is based on the design
of the reactor's interior.
tooltip.biggerreactors.symbols.fuel_heat:
§bFuel Heat
Heat of the reactor's casing.
High heat raises energy output
and coolant conversion.
tooltip.biggerreactors.symbols.coolant_t:
§bCoolant Fluid Tank
Casing heat will superheat
coolant in this tank.
tooltip.biggerreactors.symbols.hot_tank:
§bHot Fluid Tank
Superheated coolant will
pump into this tank, and
must be piped out via
coolant ports.
tooltip.biggerreactors.symbols.reactor_t:
§bCore Temperature
Temperature inside the reactor core.
Higher temperatures increase fuel
burn-up.
tooltip.biggerreactors.symbols.fuel_cons:
§bFuel Burn-up Rate
The rate at which fuel is fissioned
into waste in the core.
tooltip.biggerreactors.symbols.fuel_reac:
§bFuel Reactivity
How heavily irradiated the core is.
Higher levels of radiation reduce
fuel burn-up.
